item.content:encoded: This is my second game jam, and I’m happy about what I was able to accomplish, this time on my own! My game is called Climb the Tower, and it certainly has some rough edges. I don’t know if this is the correct link to what I made, but here is one: https://drive.google.com/drive/search?q=parent:1UfoqbFewZg3DdAQ9mcpy0aQKRvXXQzzt

item.title: Jack-o-Random – Henry Stadolnik – Thing Jam 2020
item.dc:creator: Joseph Stadolnik
item.description: A simple jack-o-lantern generator, created in PICO-8 with just 1 tweet’s worth of code! Full Code: You can run the cart for yourself here: https://www.lexaloffle.com/bbs/?tid=39984
item.content:encoded:
A simple jack-o-lantern generator, created in PICO-8 with just 1 tweet’s worth of code!

Full Code:

--jack-o-random by jusiv
o=ovalfill
r=circfill
n=rnd
poke(0x5f2c,5)t=0::_::
if t==0then
cls(2)o(60,18-n(6),68,39,4)o(16,34-n(4),48,106+n(4),9)o(30,30-n(6),76,110+n(6))r(40,58,8,10)r(62,66,7)o(32,78,96,94)for i=0,n(10)do
r(32+n(34),50+n(34),4+n(8),9)end
end
flip()t=(t+1)%99
goto _


You can run the cart for yourself here: https://www.lexaloffle.com/bbs/?tid=39984

item.title: Thing Jam – Fall 2020
item.dc:creator: Mikel Matticoli
item.description:
Winners Most Unexpected Thing: Emma Lowry Best Pumpkin: Ben Slattery Best Pumpkin: Samuel Darer Projects Thing Jam? Whatâ€™s That? tl;dr: A fun event where you…
Continue ReadingThing Jam – Fall 2020
item.content:encoded:
Winners

  • Most Unexpected Thing: Emma Lowry
  • Best Pumpkin: Ben Slattery
  • Best Pumpkin: Samuel Darer

Projects

  • Tiny Swords – Emma Lowry – Thing Jam 2020
    by Emma Lowry
    October 21, 2020
  • Fear of Depths Soundtrack – Ben Slattery – Thing Jam 2020
    by Benjamin Slattery
    October 21, 2020
  • Climb the Tower – Samuel Darer- Thing Jam 2020
    by Samuel Darer
    October 21, 2020
  • Jack-o-Random – Henry Stadolnik – Thing Jam 2020
    by Joseph Stadolnik
    October 20, 2020

Thing Jam? Whatâ€™s That?

tl;dr: A fun event where you make things!

It can be anything! Art, vfx, game, mod, audio – go nuts, or just polish up an old project and show it off to the community!

The theme for the jam is optional: Pumpkin

This is just to help inspire ideas if you want to start from scratch, if youve already got something in mind, no need to integrate pumpkins (unless you want to )

PRIZES!

IGDA Exec will be picking a few prize winners for fun. The categories are:

– Best pumpkin
– Best meme Best pumpkin, because you can’t have too much pumpkin
– Most unexpected thing

Take that as you will – winners will be announced sometime after 6PM on Tuesday October 20th.

Submission Instructions

(Submissions are Open through 10/21/2020, but only submissions posted by the end of day on 10/20 will be considered for prizes)

  1. Visit ./../register/index.html and fill out the form to register an account (or click sign in if you’ve already made one)
  2. You should be redirected to the dashboard (if not, you can find it at ./../wp-admin)/index.html
  3. Click the “Posts” tab on the left sidebar and select “Add New”
    • Title your post:
      <Project Name> – <Your name> – Thing Jam 2020
    • On the right sidebar, click the Document tab and scroll down to the Categories section â€” select the “2020 Thing Jam” category under Projects
      (we also recommend setting a “featured image” but this is optional)
    • You can add text/image/video content to present your project however you’d like – if you have any questions feel free to ping an exec on Discord!
  4. When you’re ready, click the Submit/Publish button at the top right of the screen!

    If you have other files (a game/large video etc) that can not be uploaded directly to the site, you can drop them in the Google Drive folder here:
    https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UfoqbFewZg3DdAQ9mcpy0aQKRvXXQzzt?usp=sharing
    And include a link to your files in your post

But what ifâ€¦?

  1. You donâ€™t need any prior experience! Game jams are a great place to learn something new
  2. You donâ€™t need to make a video game! You can make a board game, art piece, or some other form of media
  3. If you have a project you want to work on during the jam thatâ€™s cool too! Itâ€™s a good chance to chill and crank out a project with friends
  4. You donâ€™t have to have something completed at the end! Sometimes scope, homework, or life gets in the way of finishing a project. If you feel comfortable doing so, feel free to showcase whatever youâ€™ve got or share what you learned!

I wanna do one of these!

Make sure youâ€™ve joined our Discord for meeting/event reminders: ./../discord/index.html
(If you are remote and canâ€™t access discord in your home country, reach out to us at gr-igdaexec@wpi.edu and weâ€™ll help you out!)

House Rules

IGDA WPI is a safe, inclusive, and overall chill space. We only have 3 rules:

  1. Donâ€™t be a dick
    • No alcohol/drugs/sexual content in any games
    • Donâ€™t give unsolicited advice â€“ some people are uncomfortable having their works in progress critiqued. Wait until theyâ€™re ready for feedback!
    • As a general rule of thumb, just be respectful and kind to others
  2. If someone tells you youâ€™re being a dick, stop
  3. If youâ€™re unsure whether or not youâ€™re being a dick, ask an exec

item.title: A20 Game Jam
item.dc:creator: IGDA WPI
item.description:
And the theme isss *drumroll*… Together Check out some of the games below, and we hope to see you at our next jam! Stay tuned…
Continue ReadingA20 Game Jam
item.content:encoded:
And the theme isss *drumroll*…
Together

Check out some of the games below, and we hope to see you at our next jam!

Stay tuned for a demo reel…

In case you missed it, here’s the kickoff slides:

And the games!

Game Jam? What’s That?

tl;dr: A fun event where you make games and stuff!

Game Jams can last anywhere from a few hours to a few days/weeks. At the start of the jam you get a theme – this will usually be something abstract word/phrase like “Double” or “Every day we stray further from the light.” Then you hop on a team, brainstorm, and make something!

But what if…?

  1. You don’t need any prior experience! Game jams are a great place to learn something new
  2. You don’t need to make a video game! You can make a board game, art piece, or some other form of media
  3. If you have a project you want to work on during the jam that’s cool too! It’s a good chance to chill and crank out a project with friends
  4. You don’t have to have something completed at the end! Sometimes scope, homework, or life gets in the way of finishing a project. If you feel comfortable doing so, feel free to showcase whatever you’ve got or share what you learned!

I wanna do one of these!

Make sure you’ve joined our Discord for meeting/event reminders: ./../discord/index.html
(If you are remote and can’t access discord in your home country, reach out to us at gr-igdaexec@wpi.edu and we’ll help you out!)

House Rules

IGDA WPI is a safe, inclusive, and overall chill space. We only have 3 rules:

  1. Don’t be a dick
    • No alcohol/drugs/sexual content in any games
    • Don’t give unsolicited advice – some people are uncomfortable having their works in progress critiqued. Wait until they’re ready for feedback!
    • As a general rule of thumb, just be respectful and kind to others
  2. If someone tells you you’re being a dick, stop
  3. If you’re unsure whether or not you’re being a dick, ask an exec

item.content:encoded:
While we’re all quarantined in our respective locations, it’s a good time to look back at an old project and work on it a little – here’s some of the work our members polished up for the jam!

  • Polish Jam – Gifts 2.0 – Dylan ValevApril 29, 2020
    It’s never too early for holiday cheer. Celebrate sooner with Gifts 2,0, touched up during the Quarantine Polish Jam of 2020!
  • Polish Jam – Digital Art – Karen HouApril 29, 2020
    I don’t usually do a lot of digital art due to lack of time, but I wanted to whip out the ol’ Photoshop and dust…
    Continue ReadingPolish Jam – Digital Art – Karen Hou
  • Polish Jam: Untitled Factory Game – Charlie BaldwinApril 29, 2020
    I’ve been slowly learning Unity more and working on developing this concept, and I took advantage of the polish jam to add a few additions.…
    Continue ReadingPolish Jam: Untitled Factory Game – Charlie Baldwin
  • Polish Jam – Joker Painting – Jasmine DuerkApril 29, 2020
    For Polish Jam, I painted over a sketch I did before of Joker from Persona 5.
  • Polish Jam 3D Model Progress 2020 – Sarah LoveApril 29, 2020
    For this polish jam I decided to work on the modeling and painting for a D&D character I have been working with on the side…
    Continue ReadingPolish Jam 3D Model Progress 2020 – Sarah Love

item.title: Polish Jam – Digital Art – Karen Hou
item.dc:creator: Karen Hou
item.description:
I don’t usually do a lot of digital art due to lack of time, but I wanted to whip out the ol’ Photoshop and dust…
Continue ReadingPolish Jam – Digital Art – Karen Hou
item.content:encoded:
I don’t usually do a lot of digital art due to lack of time, but I wanted to whip out the ol’ Photoshop and dust it off. Here’s what I’ve worked on! Did not have a lot of time as I would’ve liked, but here’s what I got done!

First I sketched it out in pen, then I played around with some color combos, then I finished it up.

Mostly just playing around with colors and stuff. But all in all it was a good and quick picture to get re-acquainted with digital painting in Photoshop!

item.title: Polish Jam: Untitled Factory Game – Charlie Baldwin
item.dc:creator: Charlie Baldwin
item.description:
I’ve been slowly learning Unity more and working on developing this concept, and I took advantage of the polish jam to add a few additions.…
Continue ReadingPolish Jam: Untitled Factory Game – Charlie Baldwin
item.content:encoded: I’ve been slowly learning Unity more and working on developing this concept, and I took advantage of the polish jam to add a few additions. The game takes inspiration from Satisfactory, Factorio, and modded Minecraft.
